Package org.dellroad.dataskin.viewer.display

Interface DisplayHooks

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicDisplayHooks
public interface DisplayHooks
Display callbacks.

The methods in this class may assume that there is a current VaadinSession.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method

  • Method Details

    • buildConfigDialog

      <C, R> void buildConfigDialog(Dialog dialog, Operation<C,R> operation, C config, Consumer<? super C> onConfirm, Runnable onCancel)
      Populate the give Dialog with a form for configuring the given operation.

      This method should layout a form for editing the given configuration and arrange for one of the callbacks to be invoked when done.

      Parameters:
      dialog - dialog window to populate
      operation - the operation being configured
      config - the configuration to edit
      onCancel - to invoke if configuration operation is canceled
      onConfirm - to invoke if configuration operation is confirmed

    • buildQueryDisplay

      <C, R> QueryDisplay<R> buildQueryDisplay(Query<C,R> query, C config)
      Build the component(s) that will display the results of a successful query operation.

      The component must be or contain a Grid somewhere.

      Note: no data provider should be configured; the caller of this method is responsible for that.

      Parameters:
      query - the query (to be) performed
      config - the query configuration

    • displayActionResult

      <C, R> void displayActionResult(UI ui, Action<C,R> action, C config, R result)
      Display a notification that the given action, which was configured via config, was successful and produced given result.

      Typically this is done via a Notification.

      Parameters:
      ui - associated Vaadin UI
      action - the action that was performed
      result - the result from the action

    • displayOperationError

      <C, R> void displayOperationError(UI ui, Operation<C,R> operation, C config, Throwable error)
      Display a notification that the given operation, which was configured via config, failed with the given exception.

      Typically this is done via a Notification.

      If the exception is an InterruptedException, then the operation was cancelled.

      Parameters:
      ui - associated Vaadin UI
      operation - the operation that failed
      config - the operation's configuration
      error - the exception caught
